Generation VII.Sun: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
Generation VII.Moon: Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It remains calm and unmoving no matter the situation. It mixes dirt with the saliva in its mouth to make a special kind of mud.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It can trudge mountain roads without rest for three days and three nights, all the while dragging a 10-ton load.

Generation VIII.Sword: Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale's legs sets harder than stone. It's so hard that it allows this Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.
Generation VIII.Shield: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.

Generation IX.Scarlet: This Pokémon has been treasured not just for its physical labor but also because it produces high-quality mud used for making pottery.
Generation IX.Violet: Its legs are fortified with mud and harder than stone, and they can reduce a large truck to scrap with one kick.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Poni Plains Route 12 , Blush Mountain ( SOS Battle )
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Poni Plains Route 12 , Blush Mountain ( SOS Battle )

Generation VIII.Sword: Axew's Eye , Giant's Seat , Dusty Bowl Rolling Fields , Bridge Field ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Axew's Eye , Giant's Seat , Dusty Bowl Rolling Fields , Bridge Field ( Max Raid Battle )

Generation IX.Scarlet: South Province: Area Six North Province: Area One , Dalizapa Passage , Glaseado Mountain Tera Raid Battles ( 5★ )
Generation IX.Violet: South Province: Area Six North Province: Area One , Dalizapa Passage , Glaseado Mountain Tera Raid Battles ( 5★ )
